title.narrative: BEHAVIORAL CHANGE FOR OPTIMAL NUTRITIONPRACTICES IN COMMUNITIES

description.narrative: By 2020, adolescent girls, women of childbearing age and family members, including men, and community leaders have knowledge and aptitudes that enable optimal nutrition practices.

mailing-address.narrative: Immeuble des Nations Unies - Koulouba 01 BP 3420 - Ouagadougou 01

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Maternal nutrition, including information, supplementation and counselling
National multisectoral strategies and plans to prevent stunting (excludes intervention-specific strategies)
Prevention of undernutrition in adolescence (10 to 19 years)

title.narrative: Burkina Faso United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Burkina Faso Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Nutrition)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Burkina Faso 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Burkina Faso Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, adolescent girls, women of childbearing age and family members, including men, and community leaders have knowledge and aptitudes that enable optimal nutrition practices.

description.narrative: With UNICEF support, seven NGOs in 7 health regions, 2,401 villages out of 3,000 planned (80%) provided infant and young child feeding (IYCF) services. 22,579 mothers support groups met monthly with facilitation of 7,686 CBHWs and 3,181 community volunteers. 558,767 pregnant and lactating women benefited from IYCF counselling services. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of primary caregivers of children aged 0-23 months who received counselling on IYCF
Number of service delivery points (health facility or community) that provide IYCF counselling
% of childbearing women, caretakers (father, mother-in-law, grandmother), adolescent girls and community leaders who know at least 4 optimal IYCF practices
Number of pregnant and lactating women (children from 0-24 months) who received IYCF counselling services
Number of villages with community health workers trained to deliver IYCF counselling services
